abstract_summ: A fully automated computationally efficient protein structure prediction method would be particularly beneficial in the field of cryo-EM as the technology allows researchers to photograph multiple large protein complexes in a single study, which means that a fast prediction method could allow for a high throughput of derived protein structures.The ability to predict protein–protein interactions is crucial to our understanding of a wide range of biological activities and functions in the human body, and for guiding drug discovery.A topology-based network tree is constructed by integrating the topological representation and NetTree for predicting protein–protein interaction ΔΔG.The hotWater model is freely available at (https://pypi.org/project/hotWater/).The scientific community is rapidly generating protein sequence information, but only a fraction of these proteins can be experimentally characterized.This model is fine-tuned to solve two different protein prediction tasks: protein family classification and protein interaction prediction.
title_summ: SSnet - Secondary Structure based End-to-End Learning model for Protein-Ligand Interaction PredictionDeep learning model can predict water binding sites on the surface of proteins using limited-resolution dataTransforming the Language of Life: Transformer Neural Networks for Protein Prediction TasksASGN: An Active Semi-supervised Graph Neural Network for Molecular Property PredictionA benchmark study on reliable molecular supervised learning via Bayesian learningGEOM: Energy-annotated molecular conformations for property prediction and molecular generationRepresentation of molecular structures with persistent homology for machine learning applications in chemistryDeepTracer: Predicting Backbone Atomic Structure from High Resolution Cryo-EM Density Maps of Protein ComplexesPhosTransfer: A Deep Transfer Learning Framework for Kinase-Specific Phosphorylation Site Prediction in HierarchyA topology-based network tree for the prediction of protein–protein binding affinity changes following mutationUsing Machine Learning in Accuracy Assessment of Knowledge-Based Energy and Frequency Base Likelihood in Protein StructuresAFP-LSE: Antifreeze Proteins Prediction Using Latent Space Encoding of Composition of k-Spaced Amino Acid Pairs.iBioProVis: Interactive Visualization and Analysis of Compound Bioactivity Space.
title_abstract_phrases: A fully automated computationally efficient protein structure prediction method would be particularly beneficial in the field of cryo-EM as the technology allows researchers to photograph multiple large protein complexes in a single study, which means that a fast prediction method could allow for a high throughput of derived protein structures.A topology-based network tree for the prediction of protein–protein binding affinity changes following mutationThe ability to predict protein–protein interactions is crucial to our understanding of a wide range of biological activities and functions in the human body, and for guiding drug discovery.This model is fine-tuned to solve two different protein prediction tasks: protein family classification and protein interaction prediction.Tests on major benchmark datasets indicate that the proposed topology-based network tree is an important improvement over the current state of the art in predicting ΔΔG.Using Machine Learning in Accuracy Assessment of Knowledge-Based Energy and Frequency Base Likelihood in Protein StructuresMany aspects of the study of protein folding and dynamics have been affected by the accumulation of data about native protein structures and recent advances in machine learning.A topology-based network tree is constructed by integrating the topological representation and NetTree for predicting protein–protein interaction ΔΔG.
